intro: Catopsis delicatula, commonly known as the delicate catopsis, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and small, oval-shaped leaves that are often recurved. This moss typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. It forms dense cushions or mats, which help retain moisture and provide habitat for microorganisms. Catopsis delicatula is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid and cool climates.
